title: Separating Terms
text: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following: $$\frac{51y^4}{3y^2}+\frac{42y^2}{3y^2}$$
speech: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following:  fraction, 51 y to the fourth, over, 3 y squared,  plus fraction, 42 y squared, over, 3 y squared,
pacedSpeech: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following:   fraction, 51 y to the fourth, over, 3 y squared,  plus fraction, 42 y squared, over, 3 y squared,

title: Simplify Terms
text: What is the result once each fraction term is simplified?
speech: What is the result once each fraction term is simplified?
